channel.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
channel.description: Has anyone played any of them? I played one as a child on my GBA and it was kick-ass. I'm thinking about getting it again for a very cheap price and playing it. Thoughts?

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:19, topic:480714”]Somewhat related?

Most of my friends in college play Yu-Gi-Oh like this. I was disassembling someone’s deck last night because he had a 1.5:1 Magic/Trap:Monster ratio and he kept drawing magic cards during his duels ending up in his losses.

Card games are pretty fun. Sadly I have no time to dedicate myself to them.

OT: I use ROMS on VBA to play various yu-gi-oh games, so you guys can probably do that now.

Read full topic

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Lin:

I have and actually recently played through Dark Duel Stories for the GBC, played and still own a GBA one that’s like something Memories, and then I played one for I think the Play Station, if not PS2.

Get the Falsebound Kingdom, you won’t regret it.

Read full topic

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:7, topic:480714”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=598951.msg4210925#msg4210925 date=1359525315]

I have played Duelist of the Roses for PS2 (it was messed up), and also The Eternal Duelist Soul for GBA (it’s actually still in my DS I haven’t touched in a year or two :P)

holy shit i loved that one

It was kind of confusing compared to the typical thing you’d expect, but for PS2, it was surprisingly really fun, especially if you watched the battles.

For some reason I always picked to be a white rose
For some reason I just liked how you had to progress to harder bosses etc

[/quote]A little update guys, I actually did go out and get a Yu-Gi-Oh game.

7 Trials to Glory for my GBA. It was rated #1 on some dudes list, and I think I played this one as a child (and it’s badass!). But anyways, I’ll let you know when I finish it.[/quote]
yep i think thats the one

Read full topic

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I’d highly recommend The Falsebound Kingdom for the GC. It’s an excellent buy, costs about $10 on Amazon and it’s hundreds of hours of great entertainment. I recently bought it again after playing it so much in my childhood.

Read full topic

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh video games?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:6, topic:480714”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=598951.msg4210924#msg4210924 date=1359525269]

I have played Duelist of the Roses for PS2 (it was messed up), and also The Eternal Duelist Soul for GBA (it’s actually still in my DS I haven’t touched in a year or two :P)

holy shit i loved that one

It was kind of confusing compared to the typical thing you’d expect, but for PS2, it was surprisingly really fun, especially if you watched the battles.
[/quote]
For some reason I always picked to be a white rose
For some reason I just liked how you had to progress to harder bosses etc[/quote]A little update guys, I actually did go out and get a Yu-Gi-Oh game.

7 Trials to Glory for my GBA. It was rated #1 on some dudes list, and I think I played this one as a child (and it’s badass!). But anyways, I’ll let you know when I finish it.

Read full topic

It was kind of confusing compared to the typical thing you’d expect, but for PS2, it was surprisingly really fun, especially if you watched the battles. :D[/quote]
For some reason I always picked to be a white rose
For some reason I just liked how you had to progress to harder bosses etc
